V3 added Dependencies column showing feature relationships. All iterations edited existing content, preserved rows and columns, maintained context. good: V1 correctly added Risk Level column with High/Medium/Low values and color coding
V1 preserved all 20 rows and original 4 columns
V2 sorted rows by Risk Level - High risk features at top
V2 preserved Risk Level column and all content from V1
V3 added Dependencies column with meaningful feature relationships
V3 preserved sort order from V2 and all columns
All iterations edited in place - no new artifacts created
Perfect iteration continuity - each version builds on previous

prompts.title: Existing Content
prompts.text: Pre-existing feature table for elderly care app on board

prompts.title: Add Risk Column
prompts.text: Add a column called "Risk Level" (Low/Medium/High) and fill it in for each feature.
prompts.note: Added Risk Level column exactly as requested. All 20 features now have High/Medium/Low risk ratings with color coding. Preserved all original columns and rows. Column order shifted slightly but content intact.

prompts.title: Sort by Risk
prompts.text: Sort the rows by Risk Level, highest first.
prompts.note: Sorted correctly - High risk features now at top, then Medium, then Low. All 20 rows preserved with correct risk values. Risk Level styling changed to gray outline but values intact. Good iteration.

prompts.title: Add Dependencies
prompts.text: Add a "Dependencies" column showing which features depend on others.
prompts.note: Added Dependencies column with meaningful relationships. Features like 'In-app payments' depend on 'Visit check-ins'. Core features marked as 'None - core feature'. Sort order preserved from V2. All columns intact. This is how brownfield iteration should work.

runs.summary: Zero iteration continuity. V1 created new complex diagram instead of editing existing. V2 lost ALL error handling from V1 and changed to grayscale style. V3 failed to add swimlanes as requested.
good: V1 did add error handling paths as requested - multiple red/pink error boxes visible
V2 simplified the flow to fewer steps as requested
All text labels are readable without truncation
Visual quality is clean in each individual version
bad: CRITICAL: V1 created entirely new diagram instead of editing existing (layout changed from horizontal to vertical)
CRITICAL: V2 lost ALL error handling paths that were just added in V1
V2 changed style from colored to grayscale - not requested
CRITICAL: V3 did NOT add swimlanes despite explicit request
No iteration continuity - each version ignores previous work
V2 went from 40 objects to 13 - aggressive simplification deleted error paths
Cannot trace evolution from V0 through V3 - essentially 3 independent diagrams

prompts.title: Existing Content
prompts.text: Pre-existing booking flow diagram on board

prompts.title: Add Error Paths
prompts.text: Add error handling paths for: invalid input, timeout, and user cancellation.
prompts.note: I asked to add error paths to MY flowchart and got a completely new diagram. Layout changed from horizontal to vertical, structure is totally different. The error paths are there - Input Validation Error, Search Timeout, Payment Processing Timeout - but this isn't my diagram anymore. It's a new creation, not an edit.

prompts.title: Simplify Steps
prompts.text: Simplify by combining any steps that always happen together.
prompts.note: Where did my error handling go?! V1 had 40 objects with all those error paths I asked for. Now I have 13 objects and ZERO error handling. It combined steps into things like 'Open App & Enter Care Needs & Browse Caregivers' but deleted all the timeout and cancellation paths. Also the whole thing is grayscale now - where's my colored diagram?

prompts.title: Add Swimlanes
prompts.text: Add swimlanes to show which actor (User, System, Caregiver) owns each step.
prompts.note: Where are my swimlanes? I explicitly asked for User, System, and Caregiver lanes to show ownership. This is just another vertical flowchart with no swimlane structure visible. Still missing all the error handling from V1. Three iterations and I have nothing that builds on what came before.

runs.summary: V1 and V2 worked perfectly - tightened content and added Why Us section with full iteration continuity. V3 CRITICAL FAIL: Asked to rewrite Success Metrics and got a standalone metrics section instead of editing the existing document. Lost entire document structure.
good: V1 correctly tightened content while preserving all sections and structure
V2 added 'Why Us' section exactly where requested (after Problem Statement)
V2 included 4 competitive differentiators (Speed, Transparency, Flexibility, Trust signals)
Context carried forward perfectly from V0→V1→V2
V3 metrics are actually excellent - specific targets, measurement methods, definitions
bad: CRITICAL: V3 created standalone 'Success Metrics' document instead of editing existing brief
V3 lost entire document structure - Overview, Problem, Why Us, Target Users, Key User Flows, MVP Scope, Risks all gone
File size dropped from 570KB (V2) to 304KB (V3) confirming content loss

prompts.title: Existing Content
prompts.text: Pre-existing product brief document on board

prompts.title: Tighten Content
prompts.text: Make this document more concise. Cut any fluffy language and keep only the essential points.
prompts.note: Perfect edit. Overview cut from paragraph to 2 sentences. All sections preserved, just tighter. Sidekick said 'Stripped the extra words and kept the core info.' This is how Edit mode should work.

prompts.title: Add Competitive Section
prompts.text: Add a section called "Why Us" after Problem that explains how this beats traditional care agencies.
prompts.note: Nailed it. Why Us section added after Problem with 4 strong differentiators: Speed (instant matching vs agency delays), Transparency (verified profiles, real-time updates), Flexibility (on-demand, language filters), Trust signals (verified ID, panic button). Built on V1, context preserved.

prompts.title: Improve Metrics
prompts.text: Rewrite the Success Metrics to be more specific and measurable.
prompts.note: Disaster. I asked to rewrite the metrics IN my document and got ONLY a 'Success Metrics' section - a standalone page. Where's my Overview? Problem Statement? Why Us? Target Users? All gone. The metrics themselves are excellent - specific targets with definitions and measurement methods - but my entire product brief disappeared. Asked to edit one section, lost the whole document.

runs.summary: V1 and V2 perfect - Edit Document mode worked beautifully. V3 CRITICAL FAIL: Asked to rewrite Success Metrics and got a standalone metrics document instead of editing the existing brief. Lost entire document structure.

runs.summary: PERFECT ITERATION: V1 created complete ERD with all 6 entities plus normalized tables. V2 added cardinality labels and proper normalization (skills, languages, availability as separate entities). V3 added both requested entities (CaregiverAvailability and VisitNotes) exactly as asked. Each version built on the previous - textbook iteration.
good: V1 created all 6 requested entities: USERS, CAREGIVERS, BOOKINGS, PAYMENTS, REVIEWS, EMERGENCY_CONTACTS
V1 included proper PK/FK notation throughout
V1 proactively added CAREGIVER_LANGUAGES and CAREGIVER_SKILLS as normalized junction tables
V2 added cardinality labels (1:N relationships clearly marked)
V2 normalized: CAREGIVER_SKILLS, CAREGIVER_LANGUAGES, CAREGIVER_AVAILABILITY as separate entities
V3 added CAREGIVERAVAILABILITY entity with time_slot_id, date, start_time, end_time
V3 added VISITNOTES entity linking bookings to timestamped care updates
Perfect iteration continuity - each version builds on previous without starting over
Proper ERD notation maintained throughout all versions

prompts.title: Create ERD
prompts.text: Create an entity-relationship diagram for an "Uber for elderly care" app showing: Users, Caregivers, Bookings, Payments, Reviews, and Emergency Contacts.
prompts.note: Excellent. Got all 6 entities I asked for plus bonus normalized tables for skills and languages. Every entity has proper PK/FK notation. Relationships are clear. This is production-ready ERD work.

prompts.title: Add Cardinality
prompts.text: Add cardinality labels to all relationships and normalize any redundant attributes.
prompts.note: Perfect normalization. Skills, languages, and availability are now proper junction tables instead of embedded arrays. Cardinality is clear on all relationship lines (1:N everywhere it should be). This is how you iterate on a data model.

prompts.title: Add Entities
prompts.text: Add a "CaregiverAvailability" entity and a "VisitNotes" entity that links Bookings to timestamped care updates.
prompts.note: Both entities added exactly as specified. CaregiverAvailability has time_slot_id, date, start_time, end_time. VisitNotes links to BOOKINGS with note_id, booking_id, timestamp, note_content. Built on V2, preserved all existing structure. Textbook iteration.

runs.summary: V2→V3 iteration is excellent. V1 capture incomplete (cropped), but V2 shows comprehensive mindmap with expanded Trust & Safety branch (background checks, insurance, monitoring, incident protocols). V3 correctly added Competitive Landscape branch comparing traditional agencies, other apps (Papa, Honor, CareLinx), and family care.
good: V2 expanded Trust & Safety branch with detailed sub-branches as requested
V3 added Competitive Landscape with exactly the comparisons asked for
Traditional agencies: Strengths (Established Trust, Licensed) and Weaknesses (Expensive, Inflexible)
Other apps section includes Papa, Honor, CareLinx, HomeHero with differentiator analysis
Informal Family Care section covers burnout risks and how we complement
Perfect iteration continuity from V2→V3 - built on previous, didn't start over
bad: V1 capture incomplete - only shows partial mindmap with cropped connectors
V1 file size (124KB) vs V2/V3 (557KB/488KB) confirms capture issue
Some text overlap in dense areas of V2/V3 but still readable
Console errors during generation: 'Mindmap: Some nodes still dont have parent'

prompts.title: Create Mindmap
prompts.text: Create a mindmap exploring all aspects of an "Uber for elderly care" app - include users, features, concerns, and differentiators.
prompts.note: Sidekick created the mindmap successfully ('Elderly Care App' with users, tech needs, risks, differentiators) but my capture was incomplete - only got partial view with cropped connectors. Generation worked fine, capture issue.

prompts.title: Expand Trust & Safety
prompts.text: Collapse less important branches and expand the "Trust & Safety" branch with more detail.
prompts.note: Perfect. Trust & Safety is now the meaty branch with Background Checks (criminal, identity, references), Insurance & Liability (platform, caregiver bonding, professional liability), Real-time Safety Features (GPS, panic buttons, video monitoring), Regulatory compliance (HIPAA, licensing), Quality control, and Incident Reporting. Less critical stuff (tech stack, marketing) collapsed as requested.

prompts.title: Add Competition
prompts.text: Add a "Competitive Landscape" branch showing how we compare to traditional agencies, other apps, and family care.
prompts.note: Exactly what I asked for. Competitive Landscape branch now shows: Traditional Agencies (Strengths: Established Trust, Licensed, Insurance Coverage; Weaknesses: Expensive, Inflexible Scheduling, Slow Booking), Other Apps (Papa, Honor, CareLinx, HomeHero with varying verification levels), Our Differentiators, and Informal Family Care (Burnout, Guilt, Scheduling Conflicts + How We Complement). Built on V2, didn't start fresh.

runs.summary: V2→V3 iteration is textbook perfect. V1 capture failed (empty preview), but V2 created clean 7-step simplified flow and V3 correctly added parallel Emergency Request path that branches from Start and rejoins at Confirm Booking.
good: V2 simplified to 7 core steps with clean verb-noun labels as requested
V3 added emergency parallel path exactly as specified
Emergency path uses blue diamond decision shape for 'Emergency Request'
Both paths merge correctly at Confirm Booking
Visual style consistent - yellow boxes, green terminals, blue decision
Perfect iteration continuity from V2→V3
bad: V1 capture failed - shows 'No content to display' instead of flowchart
V1 had a timeout during generation requiring retry

prompts.title: Create Booking Flow
prompts.text: Create a flowchart showing the end-to-end booking flow for an "Uber for elderly care" app: from caregiver search to booking confirmation to visit completion.
prompts.note: Capture failed. Sidekick generated the flowchart (24 objects) but my screenshot got 'No content to display' - clicked too fast before canvas rendered the preview. Generation itself worked fine, had a timeout and recovered.

prompts.title: Simplify Flow
prompts.text: Simplify: merge any steps that always happen together, remove edge cases, and ensure each box has a short verb-noun label.
prompts.note: Perfect. 'Streamlined it down to 7 core steps—each with a clear action.' Clean horizontal flow: Start → Search Caregivers → Select Caregiver → Choose Schedule → Add Care Notes → Confirm Booking → Track Visit → Complete Visit → End. Every box has verb-noun label as requested.

prompts.title: Add Emergency Path
prompts.text: Add a parallel "Emergency Request" path that branches from Start and rejoins at Confirm Booking with expedited matching.
prompts.note: Exactly what I asked for. Start now splits into 'Standard booking' and 'Urgent care needed' paths. Emergency Request diamond leads to Expedited Matching which auto-assigns caregiver and rejoins at Confirm Booking. Built on V2, didn't start over. This is how iteration should work.

runs.summary: PERFECT ITERATION: V1 created warm, professional app icon with hands cradling heart + shield. V2 beautifully simplified to just hands + heart, maintaining warm palette. Context carried forward perfectly - V2 is clearly an evolution of V1.
good: V1 delivered exactly what was asked: warm, friendly, trustworthy icon with care imagery
V1 has professional quality - hands cradling heart with shield/checkmark for trust
V2 simplified perfectly - removed shield and dome, kept hands-heart core
V2 maintained warm color palette as requested
Perfect iteration continuity - V2 is clearly a simplified V1
Both versions work well at different sizes

prompts.title: Create App Icon
prompts.text: Generate an app icon for an "Uber for elderly care" app. Style: warm, friendly, and trustworthy. Include imagery that represents care/support.
prompts.note: Beautiful. Got warm purple/coral icon with hands cradling a heart, shield with checkmark inside for trust. The dome above adds protection feel. Professional quality, warm and friendly - exactly what I asked for.

prompts.title: Simplify Design
prompts.text: Make the icon simpler - reduce to a single memorable symbol that works at small sizes. Keep the warm color palette.
prompts.note: Perfect simplification. Same hands-heart concept but stripped down - removed the shield, checkmark, and dome. Just hands cupping a heart on warm peach background. Will work at any size. This is how iteration should work.

good: V1 has excellent content structure with all requested sections

prompts.title: Create Product Brief
prompts.text: Write a one-page product brief for an "Uber for elderly care" app: problem, users, key flows, MVP scope, success metrics, and risks. Use the notes on this board.
prompts.note: Nailed it. I got a proper product brief with all 7 sections I asked for. Content is solid and specific to elderly care - exactly what I'd show to stakeholders.

prompts.title: Tighten Content
prompts.text: Make this shorter and more decisive. Replace vague wording with clear choices.
prompts.note: What happened here? I asked to tighten MY product brief and got a blank template with 'Required Inputs' and placeholder instructions. All my CareLink content is gone. This is unusable.

issues: Created template with placeholders instead of editing
Shows 'Required Inputs' and 'Style Rules' - not what was asked
All actual product content was replaced with generic instructions
Document format changed from product brief to instruction template

improvements: Should have maintained V1's content and made it more concise

prompts.note: The content is actually decent - good Non-negotiables and Not in v1 lists. But why is the header 'Add the following sections...'? I wanted these sections IN my brief, not instructions on what to add. Feels like it forgot V1 existed.

issues: Created requested sections but as standalone document
Header says 'Add the following sections...' - instructional rather than actual content
Does not match V1's document style - presented as guidance instead of product brief section

improvements: Should integrate new sections into existing V1 document
Should not show 'Add the following...' instructional text

good: V1 table structure is clean with proper column headers and icons
V1 color-coded MVP/Later tags are visually clear (red MVP, black Later)

issues: Lost all Who It Helps and MVP/Later data from V1

issues: Content was regenerated rather than restored from V1
MVP/Later tags use different color scheme than V1 (orange vs red/black)

good: V1 has excellent color-coded theming (blue=family needs, yellow=caregiver needs, pink=pain points, green=ideas)
V1 layout is clean with clear visual groupings (~50 stickies)

runs.summary: Sidekick created sticky notes well across all 3 prompts. V1 had 50 objects across 5 themes. V2 successfully de-duplicated and shortened to 9 objects. V3 regrouped into requested themes and flagged top priorities, though created a new artifact rather than modifying V2 in place.

issues.text: V3 created new artifact 'Regrouped Care Stickies' instead of updating 'Elderly Care Stickies' in place
V2 reduced from 50 to 9 objects - aggressive de-duplication may have lost some nuance

prompts.title: Create Stickies

prompts.note: Love it. About 50 stickies organized into 5 clear themes with color coding - blue for family needs, yellow for caregiver needs, pink for pain points, green for ideas. Easy to scan and find what I need.

prompts.title: De-duplicate & Shorten

prompts.note: Got my 5 themes with 25 stickies and top priorities flagged. But it created a whole new artifact 'Regrouped Care Stickies' instead of updating what I had. Now I have two sticky sets on my board.

good: V1 created excellent product brief with all sections
bad: V2 replaced content with blank template
V3 created empty document

V3 FAILED CRITICALLY - instead of adding a 'Key Differentiators' section, it created an empty 'Untitled doc'. Sidekick is not iterating on previous artifacts.

prompts.title: Create Product Brief

prompts.note: Excellent first draft. 6 solid sections covering everything I asked for - problem, users, flows, MVP scope with clear IN/OUT, metrics, and risks. This is stakeholder-ready.

prompts.title: Tighten Content
prompts.text: Tighten this up: cut any fluffy language, shorten each section to 1-2 crisp sentences, and keep only the 3 most important success metrics.
prompts.note: Completely broken. I asked to tighten my product brief and got a blank template with '[Metric 1]' and 'State what you're building...' placeholders. Where's my CareLink brief? This is a how-to-write-a-brief template, not my brief.

prompts.title: Add Section
prompts.text: Add a "Key Differentiators" section after Problem that explains why this app beats traditional agencies. Keep the same tight style.
prompts.note: Even worse than V2. I asked for a 'Key Differentiators' section and got an empty 'Untitled doc' with just the template picker visible. Zero content. Sidekick said it added the section - where? The document is blank.

good: V1 comprehensive flow with proper flowchart symbols (green ovals, yellow boxes, blue diamonds)
V2 perfect simplification to 7-step linear flow with clean verb-noun labels
V3 added emergency branch exactly as requested - decision diamond with Yes/No paths
V3 paths merge correctly at Confirm Booking
Excellent iteration continuity - each version builds on previous
Visual consistency maintained across all versions
runs.summary: V1 created comprehensive 23-object booking flow. V2 successfully simplified to 7-object linear flow with clean verb-noun labels. V3 correctly added parallel emergency path with decision diamond branching from Start, expedited matching path, and proper merge at Confirm Booking. All iterations built on previous versions - excellent iteration continuity.

issues.text: No significant issues detected. All prompts executed correctly with proper iteration on previous artifacts.

prompts.title: Create Booking Flow
prompts.text: Create a flowchart showing the end-to-end booking flow for an "Uber for elderly care" app: from caregiver search to booking confirmation to visit completion.
prompts.note: Solid comprehensive flow with 23 steps - proper flowchart symbols, good coverage from search through payment and feedback. Has the decision points and branches I'd expect. Good foundation to iterate on.

prompts.title: Simplify Flow
prompts.text: Simplify: merge any steps that always happen together, remove edge cases, and ensure each box has a short verb-noun label.
prompts.note: Perfect simplification. Down from 23 to 7 clean steps. Every box has the verb-noun label I asked for. This is what I'd put in an exec deck - easy to follow, no clutter.

prompts.title: Add Emergency Path
prompts.text: Add a parallel "Emergency Request" path that branches from Start and rejoins at Confirm Booking with expedited matching.
prompts.note: Exactly what I asked for. Emergency branch with decision diamond after Start, expedited path for urgent requests, and both paths merge at Confirm Booking. Built on V2, didn't start over. This is how iteration should work.

good: V1 has coherent dark purple theme with soft professional illustrations
V1 slide structure covers all requested topics
Content improved across iterations (headlines tightened, notes added)
bad: THREE completely different visual styles across three iterations
V1→V2: Changed from soft purple illustrations to bold teal/green circular graphics
V2→V3: Changed AGAIN to cream/beige with warm earthy illustrations
Zero visual consistency - looks like 3 different designers made these
Style changes were never requested - asked to tighten copy and add notes
Unusable for real presentation - would need complete redesign for consistency
runs.summary: SEVERE STYLE DRIFT: V1 (dark purple, soft illustrations) → V2 (dark with bold teal/green circular graphics) → V3 (cream/beige, warm illustrations). Three completely different visual languages. Content improved but visual execution is broken.

issues.text: V1→V2: Illustration style changed completely from soft purple to bold flat teal/green circular graphics
V2→V3: Style changed AGAIN to cream/beige backgrounds with warm earthy illustrations
Three iterations = three completely different visual identities

prompts.title: Create Pitch Deck
prompts.text: Create a 7-slide pitch deck for an "Uber for elderly care" app: problem, users, solution, critical features, trust/safety, MVP, metrics + ask. Use the context on this board.
prompts.note: Good start. Dark purple theme with soft professional illustrations. All 7 slides I asked for with clear structure. This is a solid foundation to iterate on.

prompts.title: Make Exec-Friendly
prompts.text: Make the slides more exec-friendly: fewer words, stronger headlines, cleaner structure.
prompts.note: Headlines are tighter, good. But why did the entire visual style change? My dark purple deck is now teal/green with bold circular graphics. I asked to edit the copy, not redesign the whole thing. Now I have a mismatched deck.

prompts.title: Add Speaker Notes
prompts.text: Add speaker notes with a tight talk track and likely objections + answers.
prompts.note: Where are my speaker notes? I can't see them in the output - maybe they're there, maybe not. And the style changed AGAIN - now cream/beige with earthy illustrations. That's three completely different visual styles across three prompts. Unusable as a real deck.

good: V1 created correct table structure
V3 recovered all 5 columns
bad: V2 lost 3 columns when adding 1 new column
runs.summary: V1 created proper 4-column table with 5 features and MVP/Later designations. V2 LOST 3 columns when adding 'How we'll test it' - only Feature and test method remained. V3 RECOVERED all 5 columns successfully (Feature, Who it helps, Why it matters, How we'll test it, MVP or Later) with correct MVP prioritization.

issues.text: V2 replaced entire table structure with only 2 columns (Feature + How we'll test it) instead of adding a column
V3 successfully consolidated all columns - good recovery from V2's regression

prompts.title: Create Table
prompts.text: Create a feature table for an "Uber for elderly care" app with columns: Feature, Who it helps, Why it matters, MVP or Later. Use the critical features listed on this board.
prompts.note: Solid table with all 4 columns I asked for and 5 good features. MVP/Later badges are clean tag-style. Ready to iterate on.

prompts.title: Add Column
prompts.text: Add a column called "How we'll test it" and fill it in for each feature.
prompts.note: Same problem as before - I asked to ADD a column and it replaced my whole table. Now I only have Feature and 'How we'll test it'. Where's 'Who it helps'? 'Why it matters'? 'MVP or Later'? Three columns gone. The test methods are detailed but I lost all my original data.

prompts.title: MVP Prioritization
prompts.text: Choose the smallest MVP that still works end-to-end and mark everything else as Later.
prompts.note: Good recovery - all 5 columns are back including the test column from V2. MVP prioritization makes sense. But I shouldn't have to recover from losing columns. This worked out but it's lucky, not reliable.

good: V1 warm purple icon with hands cradling heart - professional and polished
V2 beautiful simplification to two hands + heart that works at small sizes
V2 maintained warm color palette (purple, peach, mauve gradient)
V3 delivered all 3 requested variations: warm outline, professional teal, high-contrast lime/navy
Perfect iteration continuity - each version builds on the previous design
runs.summary: V1 created warm/friendly app icon with hands cradling heart on purple background. V2 successfully simplified to single clean symbol (two hands cupping heart) on gradient background. V3 correctly produced 3 color variations: warm outline, professional blue/teal, and high-contrast lime/navy. Perfect iteration continuity - each version built directly on the previous design.

issues.text: No significant issues detected. All prompts executed correctly with excellent iteration quality.

prompts.title: Create App Icon
prompts.text: Generate an app icon for an "Uber for elderly care" app. Style: warm, friendly, and trustworthy. Include imagery that represents care/support.
prompts.note: Lovely. Warm purple with hands cradling a heart - exactly the warm, friendly, trustworthy vibe I asked for. The decorative touches add personality without being cheesy. Good foundation for an app icon.

prompts.title: Simplify Design
prompts.text: Make the icon simpler - reduce to a single memorable symbol that works at small sizes. Keep the warm color palette.
prompts.note: Perfect simplification. Just two hands cupping a heart - will work at any size. Kept the warm purple/peach palette from V1. This is how you iterate on a design without losing the essence.

prompts.title: Color Variations
prompts.text: Show this icon in 3 color variations: the current warm palette, a professional blue palette, and a high-contrast accessible version.
prompts.note: Nailed all 3 variations I asked for: warm outline version, professional teal for corporate contexts, and high-contrast lime/navy for accessibility. Same hands-heart symbol in each. Ready to present options to stakeholders.

good: V1 created organized themed groups
V2 shortened and removed duplicates
V3 regrouped and highlighted top 5
bad: V2 lost the theme headers
runs.summary: V1 created 37 objects organized into 3 themed groups (User Needs, Pain Points, Product Ideas). V2 successfully de-duplicated to 9 concise stickies but lost the grouping structure. V3 regrouped into 5 requested themes with 15 objects and highlighted top 5 with orange color.

issues.text: V2 removed theme headers (User Needs, Pain Points, Product Ideas) - lost visual grouping structure
V3 increased objects from 9 to 15, adding some redundancy with 'Critical:' labels duplicating existing stickies

prompts.title: Create Stickies
prompts.text: Create sticky notes for an "Uber for elderly care" app: user needs, pain points, and product ideas. Group them into clear themes.
prompts.note: Good structure. 37 stickies in 3 clear groups - User Needs (blue), Pain Points (pink), Product Ideas (green). Color-coded headers make it easy to scan. Solid starting point.

prompts.title: De-duplicate & Shorten
prompts.text: Rewrite these stickies to be shorter and more specific. Remove duplicates.
prompts.note: Good de-duplication - down from 37 to 9 focused stickies with clear language. But where'd my theme headers go? The blue/pink/green grouping is gone. I didn't ask to remove the organization, just tighten the content.

prompts.title: Regroup & Highlight
prompts.text: Re-group into: Trust & safety, Booking, Communication, Payments, Emergencies. Highlight the top 5.
prompts.note: Got my 5 new themes and top 5 are highlighted in orange. But the 'Critical:' prefix duplicates existing stickies - now I have 15 instead of 10. Would've been cleaner to just change the color of the top 5 rather than copy them.

good: V1 created all 6 requested features with clean purple design
Each version individually covers the requested content
bad: V2 created entirely new orange app instead of iterating on V1
V3 created entirely new green app instead of adding screens to V2
3 different color schemes (purple → orange → green)
3 different app names (ElderlyCareConnect → SeniorCareConnect → Caregiver Support)
3 different UI kits - cannot be combined or used together
Zero iteration continuity - user must start over to use any of these
V2 has truncated text everywhere: 'SeniorCareConn', 'Michae Connor', 'Butt on' broken labels
V3 has garbled/corrupted text: 'lange, Fisher Nite, ar leas liagt' visible on Appointment Alert screen
runs.summary: Asked for ONE prototype refined over 3 prompts. Got THREE completely different apps with different colors, names, and UI kits. V1 purple 'ElderlyCareConnect', V2 orange 'SeniorCareConnect', V3 green 'Caregiver Support'. Unusable as a coherent design system.

issues.text: No iteration continuity - each prompt created a brand new app instead of building on the previous one

prompts.title: Create Prototype
prompts.text: Create a mobile prototype for an "Uber for elderly care" app. Include: caregiver search, caregiver profile (verified), booking, messaging/check-ins, payment, and an emergency button. Match the vibe of the screenshots on this board.
prompts.note: Good start. Purple 'ElderlyCareConnect' with all 6 features I asked for - search, profile, booking, messaging, payment, emergency. Clean UI, consistent style. This is my prototype to iterate on.

prompts.title: Senior-Friendly
prompts.text: Make the prototype much more senior-friendly: bigger text, fewer steps, clearer primary buttons, and less clutter.
prompts.note: What is this? I asked to make MY prototype senior-friendly and got a completely different orange app called 'SeniorCareConnect'. Different colors, different name, different UI kit. And look at the text - 'Michae Connor' is truncated, buttons say 'Butt on'. This is broken AND it's not my prototype.

prompts.title: Edge Cases
prompts.text: Add the key edge-case screens: no caregivers available, caregiver late/cancels, verification pending, payment failed, emergency triggered.
prompts.note: Third completely different app. Now it's green 'Caregiver Support'. I asked to ADD edge-case screens to my prototype, not build a third app from scratch. And the Appointment Alert screen has garbled text - 'lange, Fisher Nite, ar leas liagt' - what is that? I now have 3 unusable prototypes instead of 1 refined one.

good: V1 created complete end-to-end flow with 31 objects
V2 added all 4 edge cases with 36 objects
V3 simplified to MVP while keeping safety steps
Excellent iteration continuity
runs.summary: V1 'Care Booking Flow' created comprehensive 31-object flow from search through payment and rating. V2 correctly added edge cases (no availability, caregiver cancels, payment fails, emergency) expanding to 36 objects. V3 'MVP Care Flow' simplified to 14 objects while preserving safety-critical emergency path.

issues.text: No significant issues. All prompts executed correctly with proper iteration.

prompts.title: Create Booking Flow
prompts.text: Draw the end-to-end flow for an elderly care booking app: find caregiver -> book -> caregiver arrives -> updates during visit -> pay -> rate. Include emergencies.
prompts.note: Comprehensive flow with 31 steps covering the full journey - search, book, visit, payment, rating. Emergency path branches off where it should. This is a solid foundation.

prompts.title: Add Edge Cases
prompts.text: Add the main edge cases: no availability, caregiver cancels, payment fails, emergency happens.
prompts.note: All 4 edge cases added exactly where they belong - no availability, cancellations, payment failures, emergencies. Decision diamonds with proper alternate paths. Built on V1 without breaking anything. Great iteration.

prompts.title: Simplify to MVP
prompts.text: Simplify this to the MVP flow, but keep the safety-critical steps.
prompts.note: Smart simplification to 14 steps. Kept the emergency path - that's non-negotiable for this app. Removed the complex edge cases but the core flow is clean and complete. This is what goes in the MVP spec.

good: V1 has cohesive purple/lavender theme with purple & orange accents
V1 slide structure covers all 7 requested topics
V2→V3 maintained consistent cream/orange style (iteration worked after V2)
Content improved across iterations - headlines tightened, notes added
bad: V1→V2: Complete color palette change from purple/lavender to cream/beige
V1→V2: Illustration style changed from purple figures to earthy tones
V1→V2: Accent colors changed from purple/yellow to orange/green
Style change was not requested - only asked to tighten copy
runs.summary: STYLE DRIFT AT V2: V1 (purple/lavender backgrounds, purple & orange accents) → V2 (cream/beige backgrounds, orange & green accents). V3 maintained V2's style. Content improved but V1's visual identity was abandoned when editing.

issues.text: V1→V2: Background color changed from purple/lavender to cream/beige
V1→V2: Accent colors changed from purple/yellow to orange/green
V1's visual brand abandoned - would confuse stakeholders reviewing iterations

prompts.title: Create Pitch Deck
prompts.text: Create a 7-slide pitch deck for an "Uber for elderly care" app: problem, users, solution, critical features, trust/safety, MVP, metrics + ask. Use the context on this board.
prompts.note: Nice deck. Purple/lavender theme with consistent illustrations. All 7 slides I asked for covering the full pitch story. Ready to iterate on copy and add notes.

prompts.title: Make Exec-Friendly
prompts.text: Make the slides more exec-friendly: fewer words, stronger headlines, cleaner structure.
prompts.note: Copy is tighter, good. But where's my purple deck? It's completely cream/beige now with orange/green accents. I asked to tighten copy, not redesign. Now I can't use slides from V1 and V2 together - they don't match.

prompts.title: Add Speaker Notes
prompts.text: Add speaker notes with a tight talk track and likely objections + answers.
prompts.note: Where are my speaker notes? I asked for a talk track and objection handling but I can't see any notes in the output. Maybe they're there but hidden? That doesn't help me present. At least it kept V2's style this time.

good: V1 created warm hero image matching purple style
V2 simplified while keeping warmth
V3 produced all 3 distinct variations
Perfect iteration continuity
runs.summary: V1 'Hero Image Care' created warm illustration of elderly woman with caregiver on couch, purple palette, tablet showing app. V2 'Simplified Hero Image' reduced to just two figures with 'TRUST' text - cleaner composition. V3 'Hero Image Variations' delivered all 3 requested styles: minimal line art, warm photo-realistic, and high-contrast accessibility version.

issues.text: No issues. All prompts executed correctly with excellent iteration quality.

prompts.title: Create Hero Image
prompts.text: Create a friendly hero image for an elderly care on-demand app. It should feel safe, calm, and modern, and match the purple style on this board.
prompts.note: Exactly the warm, safe, calm vibe I asked for. Elderly woman with caregiver, soft purple palette, tablet showing the app in context. This captures the essence of the product perfectly.

prompts.title: Simplify Design
prompts.text: Make it simpler and less busy, but keep the same idea.
prompts.note: Good simplification. Just the two figures now - woman and caregiver holding hands. Removed the clutter but kept the core emotional message. 'TRUST' text is bold but works for this context.

prompts.title: Create Variations
prompts.text: Make 3 variations: more minimal, more warm/human, and higher-contrast for accessibility.
prompts.note: All 3 variations delivered: minimal line art, warm photo-realistic, and high-contrast accessible version. Each one is distinct but they all clearly come from the same brand. Great options to test with users or present to stakeholders.
